tit.e: Zenki and Goki (Ogre in front and the one in back)
Zenki and Goki (Ogre in front and the one in back)
Zenki and Goki (Ogre in front and the one in back)

sen.j: 前鬼・後鬼（ぜんき・ごき）は、修験道の開祖である役小角が従えていたとされる夫婦の鬼。
sen.e: Zenki and Goki refer to an ogre couple which EN no Ozunu (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the seventh century), a founder of Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts), was accompanied with.

Zenki and Goki refer to an ogre couple which EN no Ozunu (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the seventh century), a founder of Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts), was accompanied with.

Zenki and Goki refer to an ogre couple which EN no Ozunu (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the seventh century), a founder of Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts), was accompanied with.

sen.j: 前鬼が夫、後鬼が妻である。
sen.e: Zenki is the husband and Goki the wife.
Zenki is the husband and Goki the wife.
Zenki is the husband and Goki the wife.

sen.j: 役小角を表した彫像や絵画には、しばしば（必ずではないが）前鬼と後鬼が左右に従う形で表わされている。
sen.e: In the sculptures and pictures of EN no Ozunu, Zenki and Goki are often (not always) depicted in his right and left.
In the sculptures and pictures of EN no Ozunu, Zenki and Goki are often (not always) depicted in his right and left.
In the sculptures and pictures of EN no Ozunu, Zenki and Goki are often (not always) depicted in his right and left.

sen.j: 役小角よりは一回り小さい小鬼の姿をしていることが多い。
sen.e: They are mostly depicted as a ko-oni (little ogre) a little smaller than EN no Ozunu.
They are mostly depicted as a ko-oni (little ogre), a little smaller than EN no Ozunu.
sen.cmt: 括弧の後にカンマ追記
sen.e: They are mostly depicted as a ko-oni (little ogre), a little smaller than EN no Ozunu.

sen.j: 名は善童鬼（ぜんどうき）と妙童鬼（みょうどうき）とも称する。
sen.e: They are also called Zendoki and Myodoki.
They are also called Zendoki and Myodoki.
They are also called Zendoki and Myodoki.

sen.j: 前鬼の名は義覚（ぎかく）または義学（ぎがく）、後鬼の名は義玄（ぎげん）または義賢（ぎけん）ともいう。
sen.e: Zenki is also called Gikaku or Gigaku, and Goki is also called Gigen or Giken.
Zenki is also called Gikaku or Gigaku, and Goki is also called Gigen or Giken.
Zenki is also called Gikaku or Gigaku, and Goki is also called Gigen or Giken.

sen.j: 役小角の式神であったともいい、役小角の弟子とされる（実在性および実際の関係は不明）義覚・義玄と同一視されることもある。
sen.e: It is said that they were Shikigami (the spirit using magic or divination) used by EN no Ozunu, and they were sometimes regarded same as Gikaku and Gigen who were supposed to be En no Ozunu's disciples (their substantiality and the actual relation are unclear).
sen.cmt: 用語登録の「式神」の英訳(form of magic or divination)はここでは不適当だと思い、Yahoo辞書の国語辞典を参考に英訳しました。
sen.e: It is said that they were Shikigami (the spirit using magic or divination) used by EN no Ozunu, and they were sometimes regarded same as Gikaku and Gigen who were supposed to be En no Ozunu's disciples (their substantiality and the actual relation are unclear).

It is said that they were Shikigami (the spirit using magic or divination) used by EN no Ozunu, and they were sometimes regarded same as Gikaku and Gigen who were supposed to be En no Ozunu's disciples (their substantiality and the actual relation are unclear).

sen.j: 夫の前鬼は陰陽の陽をあらわす赤鬼で鉄斧を手にし、その名のとおり役小角の前を進み道を切り開く。
sen.e: Zenki, the husband is a red ogre, representing yang of yin-yang, with an iron axe, and goes in front of EN no Ozunu and clears the path as the name shows.
Zenki, the husband is a red ogre, representing yang of yin-yang, with an iron axe, and goes in front of EN no Ozunu and clears the path as the name shows.
Zenki, the husband is a red ogre, representing yang of yin-yang, with an iron axe, and goes in front of EN no Ozunu and clears the path as the name shows.

sen.j: 笈を背負っていることが多い。
sen.e: He mostly carries an Oi (wooden box carried on one's back to store items for a pilgrimage) on his back.
He mostly carries an Oi (wooden box carried on one's back to store items for a pilgrimage) on his back.
He mostly carries an Oi (wooden box carried on one's back to store items for a pilgrimage) on his back.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県吉野郡下北山村出身とされる。
sen.e: It is said that he was from the present Shimokitayama mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
It is said that he was from the present Shimokitayama-mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
It is said that he was from the present Shimokitayama-mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 妻の後鬼は、陰をあらわす青鬼（青緑にも描かれる）で、理水（霊力のある水）が入った水瓶を手にし、種を入れた笈を背負っていることが多い。
sen.e: Goki, the wife is a blue ogre (also depicted as blue green), representing yin, with a jug of Risui (water with psychic power), and she is mostly carries sees in an Oi in her back.
Goki, the wife is a blue ogre (also depicted as blue green), representing yin, with a jug of Risui (water with psychic power), and she mostly carries seeds in an Oi on her back.
sen.cmt: sees→seedsis mostly→mostlyin her back→on her back
sen.e: Goki, the wife is a blue ogre (also depicted as blue green), representing yin, with a jug of Risui (water with psychic power), and she mostly carries seeds in an Oi on her back.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県吉野郡天川村出身とされる。
sen.e: It is said that she was from the present Amakawa mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
It is said that she was from the present Amakawa-mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.
It is said that she was from the present Amakawa-mura, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 前鬼と後鬼は阿吽の関係である。
sen.e: Zenki and Goki have A-Un (inspiration and expiration, or alpha and omega) relationship.
Zenki and Goki have A-Un (inspiration and expiration, or alpha and omega) relationship.
Zenki and Goki have A-Un (inspiration and expiration, or alpha and omega) relationship.

sen.j: 本来は、陰陽から考えても、前鬼が阿（口を開いている）で後鬼が吽（口を閉じている）だが、逆とされることもある。
sen.e: Though, thinking of yin-yang, Zenki is regarded as A (with the mouth open) and Goki as Un (with the mouth closed) in nature, it is sometimes reversed.
Though, thinking of yin-yang, Zenki is regarded as A (with the mouth open) and Goki as Un (with the mouth closed) in nature, it is sometimes reversed.
Though, thinking of yin-yang, Zenki is regarded as A (with the mouth open) and Goki as Un (with the mouth closed) in nature, it is sometimes reversed.

sen.j: 伝承
sen.e: Tradition
Tradition
Tradition

sen.j: 元は生駒山地に住み、人に災いをなしていた。
sen.e: They used to live in the Ikoma Mountain Range, and caused harm to people.
They used to live in the Ikoma Mountain Range, and caused harm to people.
They used to live in the Ikoma Mountain Range, and caused harm to people.

sen.j: 役小角は、彼らを不動明王の秘法で捕縛した。
sen.e: EN no Ozunu captured them by the secret art of Fudo-myo-o (Acala, one of the five Wisdom Kings).
EN no Ozunu captured them by the secret art of Fudo Myoo (Acala, one of the five Wisdom Kings).
EN no Ozunu captured them by the secret art of Fudo Myoo (Acala, one of the five Wisdom Kings).

sen.j: あるいは、彼らの5人の子供の末子を鉄釜に隠し、彼らに子供を殺された親の悲しみを訴えた。
sen.e: Or he hid the youngest child of their five children in an iron oven, by which he complained about the sorrow of the parents whose child was killed.
Or he hid the youngest child of their five children in an iron oven, by which he made them know the sorrow of the parents whose child was killed.
Or he hid the youngest child of their five children in an iron oven, by which he made them know the sorrow of the parents whose child was killed.

sen.j: 2人は改心し、役小角に従うようになった。
sen.e: The two mended their ways, and obeyed EN no Ozunu.
The two mended their ways, and obeyed EN no Ozunu.
The two mended their ways, and obeyed EN no Ozunu.

sen.j: 義覚（義学）・義玄（義賢）の名はこのとき役小角が与えた名である。
sen.e: The name Gikaku (Gigaku) and Gigen (Giken) were named by EN no Ozunu then.
The name Gikaku (Gigaku) and Gigen (Giken) were given by EN no Ozunu then.
The name Gikaku (Gigaku) and Gigen (Giken) were given by EN no Ozunu then.

sen.j: 彼らが捉えられた山は鬼取山または鬼取嶽と呼ばれ、現在の生駒市鬼取町にある。
sen.e: The mountain where they were captured is called Onitoriyama or Onitoridake (ogre-capturing mountain), and located in the present Onitoricho, Ikoma City.
sen.cmt: 登録で鬼取嶽はOnitorigaku（不明）となっていますが、Onitoridakeの方が自然と思い修正しましたが、ネットではみあたりませんでした。
sen.e: The mountain where they were captured is called Onitoriyama or Onitoridake (ogre-capturing mountain), and located in the present Onitori-cho, Ikoma City.
The mountain where they were captured is called Onitoriyama or Onitoridake (ogre-capturing mountain), and located in the present Onitori-cho, Ikoma City.

sen.j: なお、静岡県小山町須走村にも、役小角が前鬼と後鬼を調伏し従えたとする伝説がある。
sen.e: There is also a legend that EN no Ozunu subjugated and was accompanied with Zenki and Goki in Subashiri mura, Oyamacho, Shizuoka Prefecture.
There is also a legend that EN no Ozunu subjugated and was accompanied with Zenki and Goki in Subashiri-mura, Oyama-cho, Shizuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: mura, cho の前にハイフン
sen.e: There is also a legend in Subashiri-mura, Oyama-cho, Shizuoka Prefecture that EN no Ozunu subjugated and was accompanied with Zenki and Goki.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて語順を変更

sen.j: 修験道の霊峰である大峰山麓の、現在の下北山村前鬼に住んだとされ。
sen.e: It is said that they lived in the present Zenki, Shimokitayama mura at the foot of Mt. Omine, the sacred mountain of Shugendo.
sen.cmt: 「住んだとされ。」と元サイトでも句点になっていますが、読点の間違いだと思います。
sen.e: It is said that they lived in the present Zenki, Shimokitayama-mura at the foot of Mt. Omine, the sacred mountain of Shugendo.
It is said that they lived in the present Zenki, Shimokitayama-mura at the foot of Mt. Omine, the sacred mountain of Shugendo.

sen.j: この地には2人のものとされる墓もある。
sen.e: There are allegedly their graves there.
There are allegedly their graves there.
sen.cmt: 夫婦なので墓は一つかと思います。
sen.e: There are allegedly their grave there.

sen.j: また、この地で（生駒山のエピソードと時間順序が矛盾するが）、5人の子を作ったという。
sen.e: It is also said that they had five children there (it conflicts with the Mt. Ikoma episode in time ordering though).
It is also said that they had five children there (it conflicts with the Mt. Ikoma episode in time ordering though.)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧内へ移動
sen.e: It is also said that they had five children there (it conflicts with the Mt. Ikoma episode in time ordering though.)

sen.j: 五鬼
sen.e: Five ogres
Five ogres
Five ogres

sen.j: 前鬼と後鬼の5人の子は、五鬼（ごき）または五坊（ごぼう）と呼ばれた。
sen.e: The five children of Zenki and Goki were called Goki (五鬼, five ogres) or Gobo (五坊, five sons).
The five children of Zenki and Goki were called Goki (五鬼, five ogres) or Gobo (五坊, five boys).
The five children of Zenki and Goki were called Goki (五鬼, five ogres) or Gobo (五坊, five boys).

sen.j: 名は真義、義継、義上、義達、義元。
sen.e: Their names were Shingi, Gitsugu, Gijo, Gitatsu and Gigen. (真義,義継,義上,義達,義元)
Their names were Shingi, Gitsugu, Gijo, Gitatsu and Gigen. (真義,義継,義上,義達,義元)
Their names were Shingi, Gitsugu, Gijo, Gitatsu and Gigen. (真義,義継,義上,義達,義元)

sen.j: 彼らは役小角の五大弟子と言われる義覚、義玄、義真、寿玄、芳玄と同一視されることもある（ただし、義覚・義玄は前鬼・後鬼と同一視される弟子と同一人物）。
sen.e: They were sometimes regarded same as Gikaku, Gigen, Gishin, Jugen (寿玄) and Hogen (芳玄), the great five disciples of En no Ozunu (Gikaku and Gigen were same persons with the disciples regarded same as Zenki and Goki though).
sen.cmt: 寿玄、芳玄は読み方不明。
sen.e: They are sometimes regarded same as Gikaku, Gigen, Gishin, Jugen (寿玄) and Hogen (芳玄), the great five disciples of En no Ozunu (Gikaku and Gigen are same persons with the disciples regarded same as Zenki and Goki though).

They are sometimes regarded same as Gikaku, Gigen, Gishin, Jugen (寿玄) and Hogen (芳玄), the great five disciples of En no Ozunu (Gikaku and Gigen are same persons with the disciples regarded same as Zenki and Goki though).

sen.j: 彼らは下北山村に修行者のための宿坊を開き、それぞれ行者坊、森本坊、中之坊、小仲坊、不動坊を屋号とした。
sen.e: They opened shukubo (lodgings in a temple) for pilgrims in Shimokitayama mura, which were named Gyojabo, Morimotobo, Nakanobo, Onakabo and Fudobo.
They opened shukubo (lodgings in a temple) for practitioners of austerities in Shimokitayama-mura, which were named Gyojabo, Morimotobo, Nakanobo, Onakabo and Fudobo.
sen.cmt: mura の前にハイフンpilgrims→ practitioners of austerities
sen.e: They opened shukubo (lodgings in a temple) for practitioners of austerities in Shimokitayama-mura, which were named Gyojabo, Morimotobo, Nakanobo, Onakabo and Fudobo.

sen.j: またそれぞれ、五鬼継（ごきつぐ）、五鬼熊（ごきくま）、五鬼上（ごきじょう）、五鬼助（ごきじょ）、五鬼童（ごきどう）の5家の祖となった。
sen.e: They also became the founders of the five families, Gokitsugu, Gokikuma, Gokijoh, Gokijo and Gokido respectively.
sen.cmt: 五鬼上と五鬼助の区別をつけるため、五鬼上をGokijohとしました。
sen.e: They also became the founders of the five families, Gokitsugu, Gokikuma, Gokijoh, Gokijo and Gokido respectively.
They also became the founders of the five families, Gokitsugu, Gokikuma, Gokijoh, Gokijo and Gokido respectively.

sen.j: 5家は互いに婚姻関係を持ちながら宿坊を続け、5家の男子は代々名前に義の文字を持った。
sen.e: The five families kept the shukubo by having marital relation to each other, and sons of the five families had the character Gi (義) in their names for generations.
The five families kept the shukubo by having marital relation to each other, and sons of the five families had the character Gi (義) in their names for generations.
The five families kept the shukubo by having marital relation to each other, and sons of the five families had the character Gi (義) in their names for generations.

sen.j: ただし、明治初めの廃仏毀釈、特に1872年の修験道禁止令により修験道が衰退すると、五鬼熊、五鬼上、五鬼童の3家は廃業し里を出、その後、五鬼継家も廃業した。
sen.e: However, when Shugendo declined with Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism) in the early Meiji Period, especially by Laws for banning Shugendo in 1872, three families, Gokikuma, Gokijoh and Gokido closed the business and left the town, and later, the Gokitsugu family also closed the business.

However, when Shugendo declined with Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism) in the early Meiji Period, and especially by the law banning Shugendo in 1872, three families, Gokikuma, Gokijoh and Gokido closed the business and left the village, and later, the Gokitsugu family also closed the business.

However, when Shugendo declined with Haibutsu-kishaku (a movement to abolish Buddhism) in the early Meiji Period, and especially by the law banning Shugendo in 1872, three families, Gokikuma, Gokijoh and Gokido closed the business and left the village, and later, the Gokitsugu family also closed the business.

sen.j: 小仲坊の五鬼助家のみが今も宿坊を開き、61代目の五鬼助義之が当主となっている。
sen.e: Only the Gokijo family of Onakabo still has shukubo now, and Yoshiyuki GOKIJO is the sixty-first family head.
Only the Gokijo family of Onakabo still has shukubo now, and Yoshiyuki GOKIJO is the 61st family head.
Only the Gokijo family of Onakabo still has shukubo now, and Yoshiyuki GOKIJO is the 61st family head.
